text: Braian Óscar Ojeda Rodríguez (born 27 June 2000) is a Paraguayan professional footballer who plays as a central midfielder for Olimpia. ==Club career== Ojeda began his career with Paraguayan Primera División team Olimpia. He was promoted into senior football at the end of the 2018 campaign, appearing for his professional debut on 2 December in a 3–2 victory over Sol de América; he was substituted off at half-time. Another appearances followed a week later against 3 de Febrero, as Olimpia received their forty-second league title. He also participated in three Copa Paraguay games that year. In March 2019, Ojeda renewed his contract. In July, after not featuring in 2019, Ojeda was loaned out to Defensa y Justicia of the Argentine Primera División. ==International career== Ojeda represented Paraguay at U17 and U20 level. He appeared eight times at the 2017 South American U-17 Championship in Chile, as they qualified for the 2017 FIFA U-17 World Cup in India; where he featured against Mali, New Zealand and the United States. In 2019, Ojeda played three times at the South American U-20 Championship.
